channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What ELSE does the president want to make great again? Find out in the quiz!
item.description: This week was more than tariffs! There were tortoises, genetically engineered animals, smart vacuums and a lot of other news!

item.title: How DOGE may have improperly used Social Security data to push voter fraud narratives
item.description: A DOGE staffer working in the Social Security Administration has been pushing questionable claims about noncitizens voting — apparently using data tha...

item.title: Chai Jing: China's Lesley Stahl returns to spotlight on YouTube
item.description: Chai Jing's interviews appear to strike a chord back home in China, even as YouTube is blocked in the country and popular platforms have deleted video...

item.title: Lightning strikes usually kill trees. This one just grows stronger
item.description: An author of a recent study about lightning's effect on trees in Panamanian forests says his team has gotten a large, positive response from people, i...

item.title: The controversial and obscure law being used against immigrant student protestors
item.description: The Trump Administration is using an obscure and controversial immigration law from 1952 to try to deport Pro-Palestinian activist Mahmoud Khalil.

item.title: China says it's raising tariffs on U.S. goods to 125%
item.description: China says it is raising tariffs on U.S. goods to 125%, escalating the trade war between the two countries.

item.title: Helicopter crash in Hudson River kills all 6 aboard
item.description: Six people died when a helicopter crashed into the Hudson River Thursday afternoon. Officials said the dead included a family from Spain as well as th...

item.title: China braces for strong winds, with lighter people warned they may blow away
item.description: State media is warning that people weighing less than 50kg (110lbs) may be "easily blown away".

item.title: 4/10: CBS Evening News
item.description: U.S. bag designer says she's already feeling the pain from Trump's China tariffs; Trump tackles showerhead water pressure

item.title: UK announces further £450m military support to Ukraine
item.description: The package includes funding for radar systems, anti-tank mines and hundreds of thousands of drones.

item.title: What we know about the Hudson helicopter crash
item.description: Six people have been confirmed to have died following the crash near to the New Jersey side of the Hudson.

item.title: Trump envoy Steve Witkoff is in Russia, Kremlin says
item.description: U.S special envoy Steve Witkoff arrived in Russia on Friday, the Kremlin says.

item.title: US fires Greenland military base chief for 'undermining' Vance
item.description: The US military said it had lost confidence in Colonel Susannah Meyers' ability to lead.

item.title: 4/10: The Daily Report
item.description: Nancy Chen reports on a helicopter crash in New York City that killed six people, stock market reaction to President Trump's tariff policy, and how th...

item.title: Euphoria star Eric Dane diagnosed with ALS
item.description: The US actor, who was also in Grey's Anatomy, has the most common form of motor neurone disease.

item.title: NYC sightseeing helicopter plunges into river, killing 6 including Spanish family and pilot
item.description: A New York City sightseeing helicopter has broken apart in midair and crashed into the Hudson River, killing six people.

item.title: Supreme Court says Trump administration must work to bring back mistakenly deported Maryland man
Who is Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the man the US must retrieve from an El Salvador prison?
